content.description: Neither axis has tick marks or a scale. The circle is centered at the origin.
content.question: There are 8 equally spaced points plotted along the perimeter of the circle. The points are labeled in order counterclockwise as t = 0 and t = 8, t = 1, t = 2, t = 3, t = 4, t = 5, t = 6, and t = 7. The point labeled t = 0 and t = 8 is on the positive x axis. The point labeled t = 2 is on the positive y axis. The point labeled t = 4 is on the negative x axis. The point labeled t = 6 is on the negative y axis. In the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane, the position of Particle <math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math> is given by the parametric function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> defined by <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses x subscript 1 open parentheses t close parentheses comma y subscript 1 open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math> for <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 8"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></math> seconds. Particle <math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math> is moving at a constant rate counterclockwise around a circle. Selected positions of Particle <math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math> relative to the origin in the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane are given in the graph at selected times. The position of Particle <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> is given by the parametric function <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> defined by <math alttext="g open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses x subscript 2 open parentheses t close parentheses comma y subscript 2 open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math> for <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 8"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></math> seconds. If <math alttext="x subscript 2 open parentheses t close parentheses equals x subscript 1 open parentheses 4 minus t over 2 close parentheses"><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced></math> and <math alttext="y subscript 2 open parentheses t close parentheses equals y subscript 1 open parentheses 4 minus t over 2 close parentheses"><msub><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced></math>, which of the following is true?

choices.label: The path of Particle <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> is clockwise along the top half of the circle.
The path of Particle <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> is counterclockwise along the top half of the circle.
The path of Particle <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> is counterclockwise along the bottom half of the circle.
The path of Particle <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> is clockwise along the whole circle.

content.answer: The path of Particle <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> is clockwise along the top half of the circle.
